questions.question: Which factor most determines whether a checking account stays fee-free?
options: How often you use mobile deposit
Meeting balance or direct-deposit requirements
Downloading the bank's budgeting app
Holding a mortgage with the same bank
questions.explanation: Most fee waivers depend on direct deposits or minimum balance thresholds. Automating them keeps the account free.

questions.question: After auditing statements you find $96 in ATM fees. What optimization aligns with the lesson guidance?
options: Withdraw twice as much each trip
Switch to a bank that reimburses out-of-network ATM fees
Disable mobile payment apps
Open a savings account with the same bank
questions.explanation: Choosing an institution that reimburses or waives ATM fees removes the recurring charge.

questions.question: SIM swapping can give attackers control of your SMS-based authentication codes.
questions.explanation: Porting your phone number lets attackers intercept texted codes, which is why app-based MFA is recommended.

questions.question: Which security action should you take immediately after connecting a new budgeting app?
options: Disable all banking alerts
Share your login with the app's support team
Verify the app uses secure aggregator connections and review permissions quarterly
Turn off multi-factor authentication to avoid lockouts
questions.explanation: Check that the app uses OAuth/aggregator links, then audit permissions regularly to maintain security.

questions.question: When evaluating banks with the decision matrix, which pair of categories should receive the highest weight if you travel frequently?
options: APY and wire fees
ATM network access and foreign transaction costs
Paper statement availability and cashier's checks
Mortgage loan promotions and safe deposit boxes
questions.explanation: Frequent travelers benefit most from wide ATM access and low foreign fees.

questions.question: What is the recommended first step in the fee audit sprint?
options: Call the bank to complain
Download 12 months of statements and log every fee
Close the account immediately
Negotiate overdraft protection
questions.explanation: You need a complete fee inventory to determine which charges are avoidable or negotiable.

questions.question: A quarterly tool audit helps you remove dormant apps that still have access to your accounts.
questions.explanation: Regular audits keep your banking tech stack lean and secure.

questions.question: Which automation best supports a two-institution strategy (local + online bank)?
options: Routing all paychecks into the local branch and manually moving leftovers
Scheduling an automatic weekly transfer from local checking to the high-yield savings account
Disabling ACH transfers between institutions
Keeping both accounts at the same bank
questions.explanation: Automatic sweeps ensure surplus funds migrate to high-yield savings without manual work.

questions.question: What is the purpose of documenting a weekly 20-minute banking workflow?
options: To replace alerts with manual reviews
To ensure you consistently review balances, automations, and anomalies
To convince the bank to waive fees
To eliminate multi-factor authentication requirements
questions.explanation: A structured routine keeps your system running smoothly and highlights issues quickly.

questions.question: Which notification pairing provides the most redundancy against account takeover?
options: Push alerts and printed statements
Email alerts and quarterly account summaries
Push + email alerts for logins and transactions
SMS alerts only
questions.explanation: Using both push and email channels ensures you see critical activity even if one channel fails.
